timeline.bodyText:
At minimum COLOR would be accessed from multiple threads so needs to be either volatile or an AtomicBoolean. I suspect they all need to be thread safe since Log4J could be reconfigured from any thread which would lead these to be accessed.
Might be best to just make the public methods all synchronized.
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText:
Yes, you are correct.
These were all volatile a while ago ...but I neglected to bring that keyword across from the discard branch 🙄
Synchronizing the methods is an interesting idea 🤔
replies.author: CjHare

replies.bodyText:
Okay, I went with both.
COLOR being exposed as a simple getter is an AtomicBoolean with a non-synchronized getter and the other public methods are now all synchronized.
This should avoid any locking/performance problems with the getter (which is used in the two new logger classes) which will be more frequently under normal usage then the set/update.
replies.author: CjHare

replies.bodyText: Suspect they need to be synchronized actually, otherwise you risk applying a half-updated config.
replies.author: ajsutton

timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Typically ArtemisConfiguration sticks to just the raw data types so I think we probably should invert this dependency.  So ArtemisConfiguration.getLoggingDestination just returns a string and LoggingDestination has a fromConfig that has this mapping.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Probably should warn on unknown values.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Probably should invert this dependency too so have LoggingConfiguration.fromConfig(ArtemisConfiguration).
timeline.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, I would have done but ...circular dependency issues.
ArtemisConfiguration resides in the artemis module that has a dependency on the logging module. Referencing ArtemisConfiguration in logging would now require logging be dependant on artemis.
Unless I were to move ArtemisConfiguration into that conveniently named config module 🤔
replies.author: CjHare

replies.bodyText: Turns out (after checking) ArtemisConfiguration is in util and not artemis, the inverting idea works 👍
replies.author: CjHare

replies.bodyText:
ArtemisConfiguration is in util currently.  So this would have logging depend on util rather than the other way around.  config is not actually a module, it's a directory that holds the config file. :) But I definitely wouldn't object to splitting ArtemisConfiguration out of util on the basis that util has way too much stuff in it.  Not entirely sure it's worth it.
The other possibility is to do what NetworkConfig currently does and just leave someone else to do the mapping ie https://github.com/PegaSysEng/teku/blob/9cd23ae4a876ca08b416349164d1c07b4412022f/services/beaconchain/src/main/java/tech/pegasys/artemis/services/beaconchain/BeaconChainController.java#L247
I do think there is value in keep ArtemisConfiguration working with primitives because it's going to get a major rewrite soon so the simpler it is the simpler that will be.
replies.author: ajsutton

replies.bodyText:
it's going to get a major rewrite soon

Excellent 👍

As the conversion is done only once, I'll follow the NetworkConfig  pattern
